full_text:
Formations from KC vs CIN! Chiefs offense first. Our 11 personnel was very not great. Probably due to all the attrition. But the other formations were pretty spectacular. Look at that 3TE 2WR set!!! Reid is a wizard. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/UR87Wdu0mG

Defense next. Defense was really good with 5 DB's on the field. Pretty bad with 6 DB's. Overall, they gave up 0.0 EPA/Play. That's tremendous vs a good offense. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/wiDoZ1Thpw

Cincy threw it 79% of the time. Chiefs D killed the run. They ran almost entirely 11 personnel. Their defense did pretty good as well. Held Chiefs offense to well under their season average EPA/play. Hobbled Pat and WR injuries surely contributed as well. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/lggkhRpQHQ

@thayne_griffin From the public data available from the #nflverse, but you have to be able to code to access it. No place I know has the play by play for every down with EPA. But yes, the pbp does also have win probability added. I can check when I get back on my computer.

Here's the Chiefs offensive formations against the Jaguars. That is just a whole lotta nice there, folks. Successful in every way. Also, boy isn't it nice when JuJu gets to play the whole game, and Toney gets his touches?? 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/K30tZLSTBN

Here's our defense. As a down-payment on my atonement, I have finally fixed the Dunlap glitch. He is now in his rightful place as a DL, and all numbers now account for that switch. Jax got us when we had 6 DB's on the field. Probably garbage time up 10 stats.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/oyYQUDNv3w
